server.model.gameplay

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.model.gameplay.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a player object. It will be created when a client connects to the server
    Author:
    yannik roth
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • updateResource

        private void updateResource(ResourceMap rm)
        This method updates the resource "account" of the player if the value is positive, it will be added. if the value is negative, it will be subtracted
        Parameters:
        rm -

      • playCard

        public boolean playCard(Card c)
        This method plays a card. Player must be able to afford card to do so
        Parameters:
        c -
        Returns:
        true if card can be afforded and was successfully added.

      • playWorldWonder

        public boolean playWorldWonder(WorldWonder ww)
        This method plays a world wonder stage, which basically is a normal Card
        Parameters:
        ww -
        Returns:

      • clearMap

        private java.util.Set<java.util.Map.Entry<ResourceType,java.lang.Integer>> clearMap(ResourceMap rm,
                                                                                    int i)
        this private method is used to remove any not required items from a value map.
        Parameters:
        rm - A ResourceMap
        i - Value condition to be excluded (normally zero)
        Returns:
        a Set of entries in the format [ResourceType, Integer]

      • isAbleToAffordCard

        public java.lang.Boolean isAbleToAffordCard(Card c)
        This method provides evaluation if a card can be played or not. Check if player has enough resources
        Parameters:
        Card - c The card which should be checked
        Returns:
        true if the card can be played because the player has enough resources

      • isAbleToAffordCardWithTrade

        private java.lang.Boolean isAbleToAffordCardWithTrade(Card card,
                                                      java.util.Map<ResourceType,java.lang.Boolean> checkedResources,
                                                      java.util.HashMap<ResourceType,java.lang.Integer> missingResources)
        This method evaluates if player can play the card with a trade. It returns true if so. The method currently just checks if left or right player has the needed resource. It does not check if player has a discount on trading left or right
        Parameters:
        card -
        checkedResources -
        missingResources -
        Returns:

      • getAbsoluteAlternateResourceAmount

        private java.util.Map<ResourceType,java.lang.Integer> getAbsoluteAlternateResourceAmount()
        This method counts all alternating resources. This is never used for gameplay logig as this would make no sense. However, this method is required to complete the card play evaluation with our implemented logic.
        Returns:
        a Map containing all resources with their absolute (summarized) amount.

        public java.net.Socket getSocket()

        public void assignSocket(java.net.Socket s)
        This method assigns a network socket to the player. It can be used from the server
        Parameters:
        Socket - s which is to be assigned
